definition: to run one's eyes over/to sweep one's eyes over
variant of 視|视[shi4]/variant of 示[shi4]

sentences.english: I scanned the sixty faces in my economics class at UNLV.
sentences.chinese: 我扫视了一下全班六十张脸。

sentences.english: Harry avoided his yellowish eyes as they scanned the Hall;
sentences.chinese: 他用那双黄眼睛扫视着礼堂，哈利避开了他的目光。

sentences.english: His glance swept from right to left.
sentences.chinese: 他从右到左扫视了一下。

sentences.english: Scan your subject for things that are clearly impossible.
sentences.chinese: 扫视你的物品，找出一些明显没办法画的地方。

sentences.english: Geoff’s eyes skitter over the surface.
sentences.chinese: 杰夫的眼睛向周围扫视一下。

sentences.english: The chairman ranged his eyes over the crowded conference room and began his speech.
sentences.chinese: 主席向坐满人的会议室扫视了一下，然后开始讲话。

sentences.english: I glanced around the room before I left.
sentences.chinese: 我离开房间以前扫视了一下四周。

sentences.english: If your back is turned, glance over your shoulder.
sentences.chinese: 如果你背过去了，那就扫视你的肩膀。

sentences.english: Her eyes roamed over the books on the shelf.
sentences.chinese: 她的眼睛扫视着书架上的书。

sentences.english: His eyes roamed over their faces.
sentences.chinese: 他的目光扫视着他们的脸容。

sentences.english: Her glance swept the horse-shoe curve of boxes.
sentences.chinese: 她的目光扫视着那些马蹄形排列的包厢。

sentences.english: On the bus I always manage to glance at the headlines in the newspaper.
sentences.chinese: 在公共汽车上我总是扫视一遍报纸上的标题新闻。

sentences.english: You do not read in a straight line, but rather in a sequence of saccadic movements (jumps).
sentences.chinese: 阅读并非沿直线进行，而是一连串的扫视加跳跃。

sentences.english: She affected a look of disinterest as she glanced at his newspaper.
sentences.chinese: 当她扫视他的报纸时，她装出一副不感兴趣的表情。

definition: to size sb up/to look sb up and down/to take the measure of/to suppose/to reckon
to shoot a glance/glance/to appear in a flash
to glower (at sb)/to cast an angry look
to cast sidelong glances at sb
to take aim/(fig.) to aim one's looks at/to glance at
to draw back/to move back and forth/to hesitate/in an instant
to watch attentively/to fix one's attention on/to stare at/to gaze at
